member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.AclModuleDoesNotSupportRegularSiteMapNodes
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The current ACL module does not provide functionality for regular SiteMapNode objects..

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.AmbiguousControllerFoundMultipleControllers
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Ambiguous controller. Found multiple controller types for {0}Controller. Consider narrowing the places to search by adding you controller namespaces to ControllerBuilder.Current.DefaultNamespaces..

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.AssemblyScanTrustLevelNotSupported
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Scanning assemblies for sitemap nodes is not supported in the current trust level. Consider a higher trust level or disable scanning assemblies for SiteMap nodes..

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.CannotEnumerateThreadSafeDictionary
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cannot enumerate a threadsafe dictionary. Instead, enumerate the keys or values collection..

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.CouldNotDetermineRootNode
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Root node could not be determined. Check that the XML SiteMap file exists or that there is an MvcSiteMapNode attribute defined that does not have the ParentKey defined..

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.CouldNotResolve
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Could not resolve URL for sitemap node {0} which represents action {1} in controller {2}. Ensure that the route {3} for this sitemap node can be resolved and that its default values allow resolving the URL for the current sitemap node..

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.DuplicateRootNodeDetected
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Duplicate root node detected. This usually happens when a rootnode is defined in the SiteMap XML file and/or one or more MvcSiteMapNode attributes have been defined without a ParentKey..

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.InvalidSiteMapElement
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An invalid element was found in the sitemap..

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.NoUrlResolverProvided
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to No ISiteMapNodeUrlResolver is provided for the current node..

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.RelativeUrlNotAllowed
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Relative URL is not allowed..

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.SiteMapFileNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Site map file could not be found. Verify that the path provided in Web.config is correct..

member.name: P:MvcSiteMapProvider.Resources.Messages.UnknownException
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An error occured while building the sitemap... Check the InnerException for more details..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unknown SiteMap provider: {0}.

member.name: T:MvcSiteMapProvider.FilteredSiteMapNodeVisibilityProvider
member.summary:
Filtered SiteMapNode Visibility Provider.
The Web.config setting should specify attributesToIgnore="visibility" in order to use this class!
Rules are parsed left-to-right, first match wins. Asterisk can be used to match any control. Exclamation mark can be used to negate a match.

member.returns: true if the specified node is visible; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:MvcSiteMapProvider.Filters.SiteMapPreserveRouteDataAttribute
member.summary: Apply this attribute to keep route data when rendering the sitemap (e.g. breadcrumbs). Note: Do NOT use this in conjunction with dynamic node providers!

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:MvcSiteMapProvider.Filters.SiteMapPreserveRouteDataAttribute.OnActionExecuted(System.Web.Mvc.ActionExecutedContext)
member.summary: Ensures all routedata elements are included on the node whenever the mvc action is invoked. This allows the MVC site map to have route values preserved for breadcrumb trails.

member.name: T:MvcSiteMapProvider.External.UrlUtilities
member.summary: UrlUtilities class. See http://www.west-wind.com/Weblog/posts/154812.aspx for more information.

member.name: M:MvcSiteMapProvider.External.UrlUtilities.ResolveUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a site relative HTTP path from a partial path starting out with a ~. Same syntax that ASP.Net internally supports but this method can be used outside of the Page framework. Works like Control.ResolveUrl including support for ~ syntax/// but returns an absolute URL.
member.param: Any Url including those starting with ~

member.name: M:MvcSiteMapProvider.External.UrlUtilities.ResolveServerUrl(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method returns a fully qualified absolute server Url which includes the protocol, server, port in addition to the server relative Url. Works like Control.ResolveUrl including support for ~ syntax but returns an absolute URL.
member.param: if true forces the url to use https

member.name: M:MvcSiteMapProvider.External.UrlUtilities.ResolveServerUrl(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns a fully qualified absolute server Url which includes the protocol, server, port in addition to the server relative Url. It work like Page.ResolveUrl, but adds these to the beginning. This method is useful for generating Urls for AJAX methods

member.name: M:MvcSiteMapProvider.Web.Html.MenuHelper.GetCurrentNode(System.Web.SiteMapProvider)
member.summary: This determines the deepest node matching the current HTTP context, so if the current URL describes a location deeper than the site map designates, it will determine the closest parent to the current URL and return that as the current node. This allows menu relevence when navigating deeper than the sitemap structure designates, such as when navigating to MVC actions, which are not shown in the menus
member.param: the current MVC Site Map Provider

member.name: F:MvcSiteMapProvider.Web.XmlSiteMapResult.MaxNumberOfLinksPerFile
member.summary: Maximal number of links per sitemap file.
member.remarks: This number should be 50000 in theory, see http://www.sitemaps.org/protocol.php#sitemapIndex_sitemap. Since sitemap files can be maximal 10MB per file and calculating the total sitemap size would degrade performance, an average cap of 35000 has been chosen.
